newsitem.title: UK: Korea Development Bank plans $500 mln bond - dealers.
newsitem.headline: Korea Development Bank plans $500 mln bond - dealers.

text.p: Korea Development Bank (KDB) plans to launch a $500 million bond by the end of November, syndicate managers said on Tuesday.
"KDB is likely to do a $500 million global, at between five and ten years," said a syndicate official at a U.S. bank.
"They still have to roadshow the deal. There has been no decision yet regarding the maturity," he said.
In May KDB launched a $750 million 10-year global bond at a 74 basis point spread over U.S. Treasuries via CS First Boston and Lehman Brothers.
This paper was now trading at 55 b.p. over, dealers said.
A comparable five-year deal is Export-Import Bank of Korea's $500 million bond launched in September.
Issued at 44 b.p. over Treasuries, the paper was today trading a few notches below that level, dealers said.
J.P. Morgan and Merrill Lynch were tipped to be joint lead managers for KDB's upcoming issue, but no official mandate has yet been awarded.
